pt.investors.flag1.title: Crescimento Flat 6+ Meses

pt.investors.flag2.title: Ciclo de Vendas Alongando
pt.investors.flag2.why: Ciclo de vendas alongando √© sintoma de tr√™s problemas: (1) qualifica√ß√£o fraca gerando leads ruins, (2) falta de playbook para acelerar decis√£o, ou (3) proposta de valor n√£o ressonando. Cada dia a mais no ciclo aumenta o CAC e reduz a efici√™ncia do capital.

pt.investors.flag2.impact: Ciclo alongando queima runway mais r√°pido. Uma empresa com 18 meses de runway pode ter apenas 12 meses efetivos.
pt.investors.flag3.title: CAC Subindo Sem Controle

pt.investors.flag4.title: Founder Preso em Vendas

pt.investors.flag5.title: Pipeline Inconsistente

en.problem.title: The Stagnation Trap
en.problem.subtitle: You built a product that works. Customers love it. But revenue has stalled.
en.problem.intro: If you're spending 60%+ of your time firefighting in sales while the board demands growth, you're not alone.
en.problem.card1.title: What the Founder Feels
en.problem.card1.item1: Validated product, customers renew ‚Äî but growth stopped
en.problem.card1.item3: Sales team can't explain why deals die

en.problem.card2.item2: CEO in burnout, lost between product and sales
en.problem.card2.item4: Follow-on at risk or requiring down-round

en.consequences.urgency.text: A $2M ARR company with 0% growth is worth a fraction of one with 30%. Each stagnant quarter costs millions in equity.

en.why.case.title: ClearSale: Commercial Structuring at the Beginning of the Journey
en.why.case.step1.title: The Challenge
en.why.case.step1.text: ClearSale had a validated product, but needed to structure the commercial operation to scale. Carlos Andr√© participated in defining and selecting the commercial leadership, acting as a close mentor to the operation.
en.why.case.step2.title: The Mentorship
en.why.case.step2.text: Strategic mentorship in structuring the commercial architecture: support in defining processes, pipeline, metrics and cadence. Close guidance that helped transform the sales operation into a predictable revenue machine.
en.why.case.step3.title: The Trajectory
en.why.case.step3.text: ClearSale became the leader in antifraud in Brazil, IPO'd on B3 in 2021 and was acquired by Serasa Experian for R$2 billion in 2025.
en.why.case.book.title: Documented in the book #VQD ‚Äî Vai Que D√°!
en.why.case.book.detail: Endeavor Brazil / Portfolio Penguin, 2014. ClearSale chapter, with prefaces by Jorge Paulo Lemann and Beto Sicupira.
en.why.case.takeaway: What this means for you: The gap between validated product and scalable growth is almost always a commercial architecture problem. We've solved this before ‚Äî and we can solve it for your company.
en.why.founder.name: Carlos Andr√©
en.why.founder.title: Founding Partner | Former Oracle Brazil President | Former AT&T LATAM CEO
en.why.founder.quote: B2B organizations from $3M to $240M+ ‚Äî built, not advised. With founder and operator experience, I built Alavanka to deliver this at scale.

en.faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
en.faq.subtitle: Straight answers for founders and CEOs
en.faq.q1: How long does it take to see results?
en.faq.a1: First improvement indicators appear in 30-60 days. Consistent revenue results in 90-120 days. The complete 6-month program is designed to install an architecture that generates sustainable results.
en.faq.q2: How does the pricing model work?
en.faq.a2: Hybrid model: monthly retainer (ensures dedication) + success fee tied to agreed metrics (ensures alignment). Values discussed after initial diagnosis.
en.faq.a3: Best fit: B2B Tech with validated product, $1M-10M ARR, growth stalled for 6+ months. Not a fit: Pre-PMF, B2C, or needing product pivot.
en.faq.q4: Difference between Fractional CRO and consulting?
en.faq.a4: Consulting: Delivers report and leaves. Fractional CRO: Enters operations, executes with the team, has skin in the game via success fee. The difference is accountability.
en.faq.a5: Mandatory checkpoints on D30 and D90. If there's no measurable progress or cultural fit, we end without penalty. You keep all work done up to that point.
en.faq.q6: How many companies do you serve simultaneously?
en.faq.a6: Maximum 3. This ensures depth and availability. If there's no slot, you join the waiting list with priority.
en.cta.title: Ready to Unlock Growth?
en.cta.subtitle: 30 minutes to understand your situation. No pitch, no pressure.
en.investors.badge: For GPs, Partners, and Investment Teams
en.investors.title: How Much Value Is Trapped in Your Portfolio?
en.investors.subtitle: B2B Tech portfolio companies with validated product but stagnant growth are sitting on value that can be unlocked. The difference between stagnation and compound growth is almost always revenue architecture.
en.investors.stat1.label: in total revenue built (Oracle, AT&T, ClearSale)
en.investors.stat2.label: to first result ‚Äî with kill-switch
en.investors.stat3.label: simultaneous companies
en.investors.scorecard.title: Quick Diagnosis
en.investors.scorecard.subtitle: Select the signals that apply to the portfolio company. Click "Why?" to understand the impact.
en.investors.scorecard.verdict.default: Select the signals that apply to your portfolio company
en.investors.flag1.title: Flat Growth 6+ Months
en.investors.flag1.why: B2B SaaS companies face a typical "Growth Plateau" between $20-25M ARR. Stagnation for 6+ months indicates the problem isn't the product ‚Äî it's the go-to-market architecture. Without intervention, stagnation becomes the new normal.
en.investors.flag1.stat: of companies that stagnate for 6+ months don't recover without GTM leadership change
en.investors.flag1.impact: -30% valuation after 2 flat quarters. Each additional month of stagnation compounds the loss.
en.investors.flag2.title: Sales Cycle Lengthening
en.investors.flag2.why: Lengthening sales cycle is a symptom of three problems: (1) weak qualification generating bad leads, (2) lack of playbook to accelerate decisions, or (3) value proposition not resonating. Each extra day in the cycle increases CAC and reduces capital efficiency.
en.investors.flag2.impact: Lengthening cycle burns runway faster. A company with 18 months runway may have only 12 effective months.
en.investors.flag3.title: CAC Rising Uncontrolled
en.investors.flag3.why: Rising CAC indicates channels are saturating or commercial operations are inefficient. Healthy benchmark is CAC Payback < 18 months. Beyond 24 months, unit economics break and growth becomes value destruction.
en.investors.flag3.stat: ideal CAC Payback. Market median: 22 months
en.investors.flag3.impact: Uncontrolled CAC = need for more capital to hit same milestones. Unnecessary dilution for the fund.
en.investors.flag4.title: Founder Stuck in Sales
en.investors.flag4.why: If the founder still closes most deals, the company hasn't scaled the commercial function. Jason Lemkin recommends founders spend minimum 20% of time with customers ‚Äî but strategically, not executing. Founder selling is a growth bottleneck.
en.investors.flag4.stat: of first VPs of Sales in SaaS don't complete 12 months
en.investors.flag4.impact: Founder in operations = product and strategy neglected. Risk of losing competitive differentiation.
en.investors.flag5.title: Inconsistent Pipeline
en.investors.flag5.why: Inconsistent pipeline means there's no repeatable commercial process. When each seller does their own thing, you can't predict revenue, identify bottlenecks, or scale what works. It's the clearest sign of GTM immaturity.
en.investors.flag5.stat: ideal pipeline coverage for revenue predictability
en.investors.flag5.impact: Without predictability, you can't plan fundraising, hiring, or investments. Board meetings become frustration exercises.
en.investors.flag6.title: Doesn't Know Why Deals Are Lost
en.investors.flag6.why: If the company doesn't know why it loses deals, it's flying blind. Loss reasons are the primary source of competitive and product intelligence. Without this data, adjustments are based on guesswork ‚Äî and guesswork doesn't scale.
en.investors.flag6.stat: of lost deals could be recovered with structured follow-up
en.investors.flag6.impact: Each lost deal without analysis is money and learning thrown away. Win rate drops progressively.
en.investors.scorecard.verdict.high: üö® Urgent: Multiple signs of stuck architecture.
en.investors.result.title.high: Alert: Multiple Signs of Stuck Architecture
en.investors.result.desc.low: Few signals detected, but worth monitoring. GTM problems tend to worsen over time if not addressed.
en.investors.result.desc.medium: The selected signals indicate the portfolio company has structural go-to-market challenges that are blocking growth.
en.investors.result.desc.high: The combination of signals indicates a systemic revenue architecture problem. Urgent intervention recommended before value is destroyed.
en.investors.result.nextstepdesc: Calculate the exact financial impact or talk directly

en.investors.case.badge: Case: From Zero Sales to IPO
en.investors.case.title: ClearSale: Building the Operation from Scratch
en.investors.case.subtitle: How I created the commercial structure that prepared the company for IPO
en.investors.case.step1.title: Entry: Company without structured sales
en.investors.case.step1.text: Validated fraud prevention product, but zero commercial structure. Brilliant technical founders, reactive sales.
en.investors.case.step2.title: Construction: Sales architecture from zero
en.investors.case.step2.text: Hired and trained the first commercial team. Created processes, implemented CRM and management metrics.
en.investors.case.step3.title: Result: Foundation for growth
en.investors.case.step3.text: The commercial structure became the foundation for all growth. Years later, IPO on B3.
en.investors.case.takeaway: The lesson for funds: What I did was create the sales operation that didn't exist ‚Äî hire the team, install processes, and prepare the foundation. It's this type of foundation that transforms a company with a good product into a company with scalable revenue.

en.investors.who.name: Carlos Andr√©
en.investors.who.bio: 25+ years building B2B Tech revenue operations. At Oracle, I grew from $48M to $240M. At AT&T LATAM, from $3M to $47M. I don't advise growth ‚Äî I enter the operation, create the structure, and leave when it runs on its own.
en.investors.who.quote: "When a GP calls me, the diagnosis is usually already done. What's missing is someone to enter the operation and execute."

en.investors.faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
en.investors.faq.subtitle: Straight answers for GPs and Partners
en.investors.faq.q1: How does the engagement model work?
en.investors.faq.a1: We act as a dedicated Fractional CRO, with 2 days/week in operations. Typical engagement of 6-12 months, enough time to install the architecture and train the team.
en.investors.faq.q2: What is the ideal portfolio company profile?
en.investors.faq.a2: Best fit: B2B Tech with validated product, $1M-10M ARR, growth stalled for 6+ months. Not a fit: Pre-PMF, B2C, or needing product pivot.
en.investors.faq.a3: Hybrid model: monthly retainer + success fee tied to agreed metrics. Kill-switch: If no progress in 90 days, we end without penalty.
en.investors.faq.q4: Difference between Fractional CRO and VP Sales?
en.investors.faq.a4: VP: 12-18 months ramp, ~$300K/year, 50% mis-hire. Fractional CRO: Results in 90 days, ~30% of cost, ideal for building architecture before hiring VP.

en.guia.meta.title: 7 Warning Signs of a Stalled Portfolio Company | Alavanka
en.guia.title: Is Your Portfolio Company Stalled?
en.guia.subtitle: You already know something's wrong. Board meetings become interrogations. Targets slip. The founder is burning out. But nobody can pinpoint exactly where the problem is.
en.guia.signals.title: The 7 Warning Signs
en.guia.signals.subtitle: Patterns that repeat in B2B Tech companies that stop growing.
en.guia.signal1.title: Pipeline Always "Almost There"
en.guia.signal1.text: Pipeline looks healthy on paper ‚Äî 3x, 4x coverage. But deals don't close. Quarter always ends below target.
en.guia.signal1.flag: üö© High coverage + low conversion = fake pipeline
en.guia.signal2.title: Elastic Sales Cycle
en.guia.signal2.text: Deals that should close in 60 days drag on for 120, 180. Every deal becomes a special project.
en.guia.signal3.title: Founder in Firefighter Mode
en.guia.signal3.text: CEO spends 60%+ of time on operational sales. Company becomes hostage to their individual capacity.
en.guia.signal4.title: Team Selling Features
en.guia.signal4.text: The pitch is a feature list. Nobody articulates the problem it solves. Result: commoditization.
en.guia.signal4.flag: üö© Feature pitch = race to the bottom
en.guia.signal5.title: Fuzzy ICP
en.guia.signal5.text: "Our product works for any company." ICP is so broad it means nothing.
en.guia.signal6.title: Metrics Without Owners
en.guia.signal6.text: Nobody knows real win rate or CAC by channel. Decisions made by intuition.
en.guia.signal7.title: Stagnant NRR
en.guia.signal7.text: Net Revenue Retention below 100%. Customer base is leaking revenue every month.
en.guia.bonus.title: Quick Diagnosis Scorecard
en.guia.bonus.text: A practical tool for the next board meeting. Evaluate each sign and get a clear view of GTM health.
